forecast-period.text: A low over the Tasman Sea will move away to the east today, as a high approaches from the west and extends a ridge over Tasmania. The high centre will slowly pass to the south of the state late on Sunday then move away to the southeast on Monday, directing an easterly flow over Tasmania.

Wind gusts can be 40 percent stronger than the averages given here, and maximum waves may be up to twice the height. Wind warnings are issued for today and tomorrow and describe the highest category of wind warning for that day.
For latest warnings go to www.bom.gov.au, subscribe to RSS feeds, call 1300-659-216* or listen for warnings on relevant TV and radio broadcasts.
* Calls to 1300 numbers cost around 27.5c incl. GST, higher from mobiles or public phones. Marine forecasts are also available on VHF and HF radio. View the radio schedule on www.bom.gov.au/marine
Check the latest Coastal Waters Forecasts for information on wind, wave and weather conditions for neighbouring coastal zones.

area.description: East of Flinders Island: Northern Tip of Flinders Island to St Helens Point

forecast-period.warning-summary: Strong Wind Warning for Saturday for East of Flinders Island
forecast-period.text: Winds: Southwesterly 15 to 25 knots, reaching 30 knots at times. Seas: 2 to 3 metres. Swell: Southerly 1 to 1.5 metres, increasing to 1.5 to 2.5 metres offshore. Swell: Northeasterly around 1 metre. Weather: Partly cloudy. 50% chance of showers offshore, 20% chance elsewhere.

Winds: Southerly 15 to 20 knots, reaching up to 25 knots offshore early in the morning. Winds turning southeasterly 10 to 15 knots in the late afternoon. Seas: 1.5 to 2 metres, decreasing to 1 to 1.5 metres during the morning. Swell: Southerly 2 to 2.5 metres, decreasing to 1 to 1.5 metres during the morning. Swell: East to northeasterly around 1 metre, tending southeasterly 1 to 1.5 metres during the morning. Weather: Partly cloudy. 40% chance of showers.

Winds: South to southeasterly 10 to 15 knots tending east to southeasterly below 10 knots during the day. Seas: Below 1 metre. Swell: Southeasterly around 1 metre, increasing to 1 to 1.5 metres offshore. Swell: Southerly around 1 metre. Weather: Partly cloudy. 40% chance of showers.

Winds: Southwesterly 15 to 20 knots turning south to southeasterly during the afternoon and evening. Winds reaching up to 25 knots near Eddystone Point in the evening. Seas: 1 to 2 metres, decreasing to 1 to 1.5 metres during the morning, increasing to 1 to 2 metres near Eddystone Point during the afternoon. Swell: Southeasterly 0.5 to 1.5 metres. Weather: Mostly sunny. 20% chance of a shower.

Winds: South to southeasterly 10 to 15 knots, reaching up to 20 knots about Banks Strait early in the morning. Seas: 1 to 1.5 metres, decreasing to 1 metre during the morning. Swell: Southeast to southwesterly around 1 metre, increasing to 1 to 1.5 metres about Banks Strait. Swell: East to southeasterly 0.5 to 1.5 metres. Weather: Partly cloudy. 30% chance of a shower at night.

Winds: South to southeasterly 10 to 15 knots tending east to southeasterly below 10 knots during the morning. Seas: Below 1 metre. Swell: Southeasterly around 1 metre. Weather: Partly cloudy. 30% chance of a shower.

area.description: Upper East Coast: St Helens Point to Wineglass Bay

forecast-period.warning-summary: Strong Wind Warning for Saturday for Upper East Coast
forecast-period.text: Winds: Southerly 20 to 30 knots decreasing to 15 to 20 knots in the late evening. Seas: 2 to 3 metres. Swell: Southerly 1 to 1.5 metres, increasing to 2 to 3 metres offshore. Swell: Northeasterly around 1 metre. Weather: Cloudy. 60% chance of showers.

Winds: Southerly 15 to 20 knots. Seas: 1 to 2 metres, decreasing to 1 metre around midday. Swell: Southerly 1 to 2 metres. Swell: East to northeasterly around 1 metre, tending southeasterly 1 to 1.5 metres during the morning. Weather: Cloudy. 50% chance of showers.

Winds: South to southeasterly about 10 knots. Seas: Below 1 metre. Swell: Southerly around 1 metre, increasing to 1 to 2 metres offshore. Swell: Southeasterly around 1 metre, increasing to 1 to 1.5 metres offshore. Weather: Cloudy. 40% chance of showers.

area.description: Lower East Coast: Wineglass Bay to Tasman Island

forecast-period.warning-summary: Strong Wind Warning for Saturday for Lower East Coast
forecast-period.text: Winds: South to southwesterly 20 to 30 knots decreasing to 15 to 25 knots in the evening. Seas: 2 to 3 metres, decreasing to 1.5 to 2 metres by early evening. Swell: South to southwesterly 2 to 3 metres. Swell: Northeasterly around 1 metre. Weather: Cloudy. 80% chance of showers.

Winds: Southerly 15 to 20 knots decreasing to about 10 knots in the evening. Seas: 1 to 1.5 metres, decreasing to 1 metre during the morning. Swell: South to southwesterly 2 to 3 metres. Swell: Northeast to southeasterly around 1 metre, tending south to southeasterly 1 to 1.5 metres during the morning. Weather: Cloudy. 50% chance of showers.

Winds: South to southeasterly about 10 knots becoming easterly during the evening. Seas: Below 1 metre. Swell: Southwesterly 1.5 to 2.5 metres. Swell: Southeasterly 1 to 1.5 metres, decreasing to around 1 metre during the morning. Weather: Cloudy. 40% chance of showers.

area.description: South East Coast: Tasman Island to South East Cape

forecast-period.warning-summary: Strong Wind Warning for Saturday for South East Coast
forecast-period.text: Winds: South to southwesterly 15 to 25 knots, reaching up to 30 knots until early afternoon. Winds decreasing to 10 to 15 knots in the late evening. Seas: 2 to 3 metres, decreasing to 1 to 2 metres during the afternoon. Swell: Southwesterly 2 to 3 metres, increasing to 3 to 4 metres offshore. Weather: Cloudy. 70% chance of showers.

Winds: South to southwesterly 10 to 15 knots tending south to southeasterly below 10 knots in the late morning. Seas: Around 1 metre. Swell: Southwesterly 2 to 3 metres, increasing to 2.5 to 4 metres offshore. Weather: Cloudy. 40% chance of showers.
Winds: Variable about 10 knots. Seas: Below 1 metre. Swell: Southwesterly 2 to 2.5 metres. Weather: Cloudy. 40% chance of showers.

area.description: South West Coast: South East Cape to Low Rocky Point

forecast-period.text: Winds: South to southwesterly 15 to 20 knots decreasing to about 10 knots in the late evening. Seas: 1 to 2 metres, decreasing to 1 metre late afternoon. Swell: Southwesterly 3 to 4 metres, decreasing to 3 metres by early evening. Weather: Cloudy. 40% chance of showers.
Winds: Variable about 10 knots. Seas: Below 1 metre. Swell: Southwesterly 2.5 to 3 metres. Weather: Cloudy. 30% chance of a shower.
Winds: Southeasterly 10 to 15 knots turning easterly during the evening. Seas: Below 1 metre. Swell: Southwesterly 2 to 3 metres. Weather: Cloudy. 30% chance of a shower.
